conclusion: Need to understand how position and size of objects change when light source moves backward
Objects are labeled A (Cake), B (Block), C (Shadow), D (Sandal)
Light source is positioned above objects, casting shadows on the ground
Light source moving backward will change shadow positions
Objects will move relative to light source, altering shadow positions
Size of shadows will change due to altered position of objects
Initial positions of objects: A (Cake), B (Block), C (Shadow), D (Sandal)
Light source positioned above objects, casting shadows on the ground
Light source moving backward will cast longer shadows
Objects moving further from light source results in larger shadows
Size of shadows will increase due to larger distance from light source
Objects will move further away from light source, resulting in larger shadows
